news.title: Tenant notices of termination increase to more than 5,400 as landlords look to sell before new rental rules
news.summary: There was a 35pc increase in notices of termination in the last year, with the majority of landlords ending tenancies in order to sell their property.

news.title: Manhunt for suspect who set woman alight as she is treated for burns to more than 60pc of her body
news.summary: A woman who had petrol thrown in her face before being set on fire at her Dublin home has suffered serious burns to more than half of her body.

news.title: Tusla chief apologises for statement that said girl (10) allegedly assaulted in west Dublin had ‘absconded’
news.summary: The chief executive of Tusla has apologised for the wording of a statement issued after the alleged sexual assault of a 10-year-old girl.

news.title: ‘The toughest part was saying it to my wife’ – Garry Ringrose on his tough Lions call which he does not regret at all
news.summary: Despite the impact on him, Garry Ringrose was more concerned about his wife, Ellen, and their one-year-old son, Freddie, who had made the long journey from Ireland to Australia, than the ramifications of ruling himself out of starting in the second Lions Test.

news.title: Inside the house crime boss ‘Fat’ Andy Connors’ fought to keep from Cab
news.summary: Twenty years after the Criminal Assets Bureau first set their eyes on the trophy home of ‘Fat’ Andy Connors, The Villa is to go under the hammer at auction today.

news.title: Restaurant review: Its Peruvian flavours are great but the prices are verging on punchy at Dublin’s new Hoxton hotel
news.summary: And we’re off! In the run-up to Christmas there are so many new openings in Dublin that it’s going to be hard to keep up.

news.title: Bank of Ireland’s new ‘Trading Down’ loan will encourage older people to move to smaller homes
news.summary: Bank of Ireland (BoI) will pilot a new loan product allowing people to trade down to a smaller home.

news.title: Hong Kong apartment fire: 55 dead, hundreds missing as police blame ‘grossly negligent’ construction firm
news.summary: A huge fire still burning in a Hong Kong apartment complex that has killed at least 55 people and left nearly 300 missing may have been caused by a "grossly negligent" construction firm using unsafe materials, police said on Thursday.

news.title: Sophie White: That reassuring phrase ‘Next week it’ll all calm down’ has run its course, so I’ve decided it’s time to hire a life coach
news.summary: For the last 10 years, my catchphrase has been ‘next week it’ll all calm down’ Usually by the Wednesday of any given week, I’ve uttered it with palpable desperation at least four times. And my goal for this elusive calm week isn’t even that ambitious, all I want is to finally feel caught up with myself.

news.title: Deirdre Reynolds: Conor McGregor ‘saw God’ on a psychedelic trip in Mexico – so much for moving statues in Ballinspittle
news.summary: Conor McGregor has found God (reports that God would prefer to remain missing are unconfirmed). The former UFC champion claimed he got a sneak peek at the Pearly Gates after a 36-hour psychedelic trip in Mexico. Not exactly a moving statue in Ballinspittle, but whatever works.
